com.siperian.sif.message.hm

Class SearchHmQueryRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianObjectRequest
        • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.SearchRequestBase
          • com.siperian.sif.message.hm.SearchHmQueryRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataProvider, SiperianObjectUidProvider, Serializable

    public class SearchHmQueryRequest
extends SearchRequestBase
    This request is used to search HM Entities or Relationships. The filter, aggregate and sort criteria can reference any columns in the Display Packages associated with Entity Type / Relationship Type in the search request. The criteria can use any operators supported by the underlying database.

    The value stored in GETLIST_LIMIT column of CMX_SYSTEM.C_REPOS_DATABASE table for the ORS determines the maximum number of records that can be returned. GetSearchResultsRequest can be used to get subsequent pages of records.

    In addition to a simple query where the filter criteria is specified for the Entities or Relationships being returned in the SearchHmQueryResponse, this request can be used for indirect queries. An indirect query is one that allows you search for Entities based on the attributes of associated Relationships and associated Entities. For example you would use an indirect query if you wanted to search an Employee based on the attributes of a Company the employee works for or the relationships between the Employee and the Company. Indirect query can only be used for searching for Entities; that is, the SiperianObjectUid in the request must be an HM_ENTITY_TYPE. If a RelTypeUid is specified in the request, the Hub Server assumes the request is an indirect query, otherwise the request is a simple query. The aggregate criteria can only be used for indirect queries. The indirect query functionality of SearchHmQueryRequest corresponds to the Indirect Search functionality in the Hierarchy Manager tool in Hub Console.

    When using the simple query there is no need to qualify column names in the filter or sort criteria with the Package name because the SQL generated only uses a single Package in the FROM section of the SELECT statement. If you do need to qualify, you can use the Display Package name associated with the Entity Type / Relationship Type.

    When using the indirect query, the SQL generated has three Display Packages in the FROM section of the SELECT statement:

    1. The Display Package associated with the Entity Type for which the records are returned. This Package has an alias "f" in the SELECT statement. The alias becomes useful if both Entity Types in the Relationship use the same Display Package (for example, when fetching Companies using "Company To Company" Relationship Type).
    2. The Display Package associated with the Relationship Type. This Package does not have an alias so you can use the actual Package name (for example, PKG_WORKS_FOR).
    3. The Display Package used by the related Entity Type. This Package does not have an alias so you can use the actual Package name (for example, PKG_COMPANY).

    Required Parameters:

    • setHmConfigurationUid(String) - UID of the HM Configuration
    • SiperianObjectRequest.setSiperianObjectUid(String) - UID for an Entity Type or a Relationship Type to be searched.

    Usage Examples:

    The following example searches for companies with more than 1000 employees located in New York and sorts the result by the company name. The SQL SELECT statement used by Hub Server is something like:

    Select ROWID_OBJECT, ROWID_ENTITY_CODE, COMPANY_NAME, NUM_EMPLOYEES, STATE_CODE from PKG_COMPANY where ROWID_ENTITY_CODE = 'Company' AND (NUM_EMPLOYEES >= 1000 and STATE_CODE = 'NY') group by ROWID_OBJECT, ROWID_ENTITY_CODE, COMPANY_NAME, NUM_EMPLOYEES, STATE_CODE order by COMPANY_NAME asc

    SearchHmQueryRequest request = new SearchHmQueryRequest();
    request.setHmConfigurationUid("HM_CONFIGURATION.Default|Master");
    request.setSiperianObjectUid("HM_ENTITY_TYPE.Company");
    request.setFilterCriteria(
       "NUM_EMPLOYEES >= 1000 and STATE_CODE = 'NY'");
    request.setSortCriteria("COMPANY_NAME asc");
    request.setDisablePaging(true);
    request.setReturnTotal(false);

    SearchHmQueryResponse response =
       (SearchHmQueryResponse) sipClient.process(request);

    // Get the Company records returned
    List recs = response.getRecords();

    The following is an example of an indirect query. It searches for employees who earn more than $100,000 and started working for companies located in New York after January 30, 2000. It assumes that the REL_START_DATE for the Relationship records between Company and Employee Entity Types is the date when the Employee started working for the Company. The SQL SELECT statement used by Hub Server is something like:

    Select f.ROWID_OBJECT, f.ENTITY_CODE, f.EMPL_NAME, f.SALARY from PKG_EMPLOYEE f, PKG_WORKS_FOR, PKG_COMPANY where f.ROWID_ENTITY_CODE = 'Employee' and PKG_WORKS_FOR.REL_TYPE_CODE = 'WorksFor' and (f.SALARY >= 100000 and PKG_COMPANY.STATE_CODE = 'NY' and PKG_WORKS_FOR.REL_START_DATE > '30-JAN-2000') and f.ROWID_OBJECT = PKG_WORKS_FOR.ROWID_EMPLOYEE and PKG_COMPANY.ROWID_OBJECT = PKG_WORKS_FOR.ROWID_COMPANY group by f.ROWID_OBJECT, f.ENTITY_CODE, f.EMPL_NAME, f.SALARY order by f.EMPL_NAME asc

    SearchHmQueryRequest request = new SearchHmQueryRequest();
    request.setHmConfigurationUid("HM_CONFIGURATION.Default|Master");
    request.setSiperianObjectUid("HM_ENTITY_TYPE.Company");

    // Set the RelTypeUid to make it an indirect query.
    Request.setRelTypeUid("HM_RELATIONSHIP_TYPE.WorksFor");

    StringBuffer filter = new StringBuffer();

    // The "f." is the alias used by the Hub Server for the Package
    // from which the Entities are being fetched.
    request.setFilterCriteria("f.STATE_CODE ='NY'");

    StringBuffer buff = new StringBuffer();
    buff.append("COUNT(*) >= 1000");
    buff.append(" and SUM(PKG_EMPLOYEE.PERCENT_OWNED) >= 10");
    request.setAggegateCriteria(buff.toString());

    request.setSortCriteria("f.COMPANY_NAME asc");
    request.setDisablePaging(true);
    request.setReturnTotal(false);

    SearchHmQueryResponse response =
       (SearchHmQueryResponse) sipClient.process(request);

    // Get the Company records returned
    List recs = response.getRecords();

      • setDisablePaging

        public void setDisablePaging(boolean disablePaging)
        Set this flag to true to disable paging so the Hub Server does not store the search results. Paging is enabled by default.

        For more information about retrieving subsequent pages, see GetSearchResultsRequest.

        Parameters:
        disablePaging - If true, paging is disabled for this request.

      • setHmConfigurationUid

        public void setHmConfigurationUid(String hmConfigurationUid)
        Set HM Configuration to be used for the request.

        The HM Configuration UID has the format HM_CONFIGURATION.<Profile>|<Sandbox>. For example: HM_CONFIGURATION.Default|Master.

        Parameters:
        hmConfigurationUid - HM Configuration UID used for processing the request.

        public void setAggregateCriteria(String aggregateCriteria)

        For more information about using this request for indirect queries. see the class description above.

      • setFilterParameters

        public void setFilterParameters(ArrayList filterParameters)
        Description copied from class: SearchRequestBase
        Used to set parameters in the filter criteria specified in SearchRequestBase.setFilterCriteria(String).

        Each element in the list is matched to the place holders specified in the filter criteria by ? symbols. The list is expected to hold Parameter objects.

        Overrides:
        setFilterParameters in class SearchRequestBase
        Parameters:
        filterParameters - ArrayList <Parameter> of parameters.

      • getRecordStates

        public ArrayList getRecordStates()
        See corresponding setter method for details.
        Returns:
        An empty ArrayList if the corresponding setter method has not been called.

      • setRecordStates

        public void setRecordStates(ArrayList recordStates)
        Set the record states (HubStateIndicator objects) to filter Entities / Relationships that are returned in the SearchHmQueryResponse.

        Only Entities and Relationships with the states specified in the ArrayList are returned. If the ArrayList is empty (default), only the HubStateIndicator.ACTIVE records are returned.

        This method should only be called if State Management is enabled for all Entity and Relationship Base Objects used in the HM Configuration.

        Parameters:
        recordStates - ArrayList of HubStateIndicator objects. ArrayList can be empty but not null.

      • getRecordState

        public HubStateIndicator getRecordState(int i)
        See corresponding setter method for details.

        Parameters:
        The index used to get HubStateIndicator object from the ArrayList returned by getRecordStates(). The index must be less than getRecordStates().size().

        Returns:
        The HubStateIndicator object at the specified index in the ArrayList.

        public void setHistoryDate(Date historyDate)
